intro: Eriocephalus namaquensis, commonly known as the Namaqua groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind, aiding in its propagation across its natural habitat. Eriocephalus namaquensis is often found in fynbos vegetation and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance.
